rev.comment: it's the developers blog: better have bad references than none at all
rev.diff:
Line 227: Line 227:
On May 3rd 2009, the lead developer of Linux Mint, Clement Lefebvre, asked supporters of the Israeli government not to use or donate to Linux Mint. This was expressed as his own personal stance, but displayed on the official Linux Mint blog. He later apologized to the development team and to the community for the initial wording of his post and for posting it in the wrong place. <ref>http://www.linuxmint.com/blog/?p=775</ref> As requested by the development team and many people within the community, the post was rephrased and moved to his personal blog. <ref> http://eclelef.blogspot.com/search/label/Politics </ref> This incident caused some users to quit the project and others to join it. <ref> http://www.linuxhaxor.net/2009/05/04/linux-and-politics-dont-mix-well/ </ref> <ref>http://www.extremetech.com/article2/0,2845,2346637,00.asp</ref>
On May 3rd 2009, the lead developer of Linux Mint, Clement Lefebvre, asked supporters of the Israeli government not to use or donate to Linux Mint. This was expressed as his own personal stance, but displayed on the official Linux Mint blog. He later apologized to the development team and to the community for the initial wording of his post and for posting it in the wrong place. <ref>http://www.linuxmint.com/blog/?p=775</ref> As requested by the development team and many people within the community, the post was rephrased and moved to his personal blog. <ref> http://eclelef.blogspot.com/search/label/Politics </ref> This incident caused some users to quit the project and others to join it. <ref> http://www.linuxhaxor.net/2009/05/04/linux-and-politics-dont-mix-well/ </ref> <ref>http://www.extremetech.com/article2/0,2845,2346637,00.asp</ref>
â
On May 7th 2009, Clement Lefebvre posted in his personal blog to further explain his position. He refuted accusations of racism and anti-Semitism, and underlined that he was primarily opposed to cruelty and terror in the conflict between Israel and Palestine.
+
On May 7th 2009, Clement Lefebvre posted in his personal blog to further explain his position. He refuted accusations of racism and anti-Semitism, and underlined that he was primarily opposed to cruelty and terror in the conflict between Israel and Palestine. In particular, he wrote: "I don't blame citizens for their need of protection or their patriotism, what I blame here are people, Israeli or not, who think the cruelty and terror used in this conflict should continue and for whom peace isn't an option." <ref> http://eclelef.blogspot.com/2009/05/personal-facts-mistakes-and-apologies.html </ref>
